newsitem.title: INDIA: Delhi shares close higher on fund buying.
newsitem.headline: Delhi shares close higher on fund buying.

text.p: Sustained buying by foreign financial institutions (FIIs) and purchases by domestic mutual funds drove Delhi share prices to a higher close on Monday, brokers said.
The bourse's benchmark index closed 13.83 points higher at 790.38.
Brokers said they expected the share prices to rise further.
"Today's rally in stock prices was a technical correction since most of the stocks had been over-sold," said Harish Malhotra of brokerage Malhotra Financial Consultants.
Another broker said: "Resumption of buying by Unit Trust of India (UTI) also aided the upward trend."
UTI is the country's largest financial institution.
ITC soared 39.75 rupees to 480.00 on heavy buying by foreign and domestic financial institutions and short covering by speculators, brokers said.
ACC gained 17.50 rupees to 1,085.00. Larsen and Toubro increased 3.50 rupees to 214.20.
Tractor and motorcycle maker Escorts Ltd rose 1.00 rupee to 81.75. Its annual results for 1996/97 (April-March) were announced on Monday after the end of trading.
The company's net profit for 1996/97 increased to 1.27 billion rupees from 1.00 billion for 1995/96. It set a dividend of 45 percent, up from 40 percent in the previous year.
